parameters.content:
# ‚ö° Step 1 ‚Äî Trigger

## What is a Trigger?

A Trigger is what starts a workflow.

No trigger = nothing runs.

---

## Our Trigger: Form Submission

When someone fills out a form,  
the automation starts instantly.

---

## What We Collect

- Full Name  
- Email  
- LinkedIn URL  
- Company Website  

This becomes the input for our AI system.

## ‚ö° Step 1.1 ‚Äî Trigger
 1.1 Form Trigger completed with all the information


# Just like How Google Form handles it




















# We can also finalize or set the information so we don't have to enter it while testing

# üöÄ Step 0 ‚Äî What is n8n?

## üîπ Simple Definition

**n8n is a No-Code / Low-Code Automation Platform.**

It allows us to connect apps, move data, and build powerful automation systems ‚Äî without writing full backend code.

---

## üîπ What Can We Do With n8n?

With n8n, we can:

- Connect different applications (Gmail, Google Sheets, APIs, AI tools)
- Automate repetitive tasks
- Move data between platforms automatically
- Add AI into workflows
- Build complete business systems visually

---

## üîπ How Does n8n Work?

Think of n8n like:

> üß± Digital LEGO Blocks

- Each block = one action  
- We connect blocks together  
- Connected blocks = a workflow  
- A workflow = an automated system  

---

## üîπ Key Concept: Workflow Structure

Every automation in n8n follows a simple logic:

1. **Trigger** ‚Üí Something starts the workflow  
2. **Action** ‚Üí Tasks happen automatically  
3. **Output** ‚Üí Final result is generated  

This simple structure can scale into very powerful systems.

---

## üîπ Why We Are Using n8n Today

Today, we will:

- Start from a trigger
- Connect multiple tools
- Add AI into the workflow
- Generate an automated output

And we will build it:

‚úÖ Step-by-step  
‚úÖ In a simple way  
‚úÖ Without complexity  

---

## üéØ Goal of This Session

By the end of this class, you will understand:

- How automation actually works
- How to think in workflows
- How to build AI-powered systems visually

parameters.content:
# üîê Step 2 ‚Äî Connecting Apps (Authentication)

## Why Authentication?
To let n8n access other apps securely.
Without authentication, n8n cannot send or receive data.

## Example: Connecting Gmail
1. Add Gmail node  
2. Click ‚ÄúConnect Credential‚Äù  
3. Sign in with Google  
4. Approve permissions  
Done ‚úÖ ‚Äî n8n can now send emails automatically.

## Connecting Other Apps
Most apps connect using:
- OAuth (Sign in)
- API Keys
- Access Tokens
- App credentials

Once connected, credentials can be reused anytime.
``

## Press Tab or + icon on the top right.

You will see different different apps

# üîÑ Step 3 ‚Äî Connecting Nodes & Data Flow

## Drag ‚Üí Connect
Drag from one node to another to create a connection.
This defines the flow: Trigger ‚Üí Action ‚Üí Output.
The output of one node becomes the input of the next.

## How Data Moves
Each node passes structured data (JSON) forward.
Example: Form ‚Üí Research ‚Üí AI ‚Üí Email.
Every step uses the previous step‚Äôs data.

## Running Multiple Times
Every new trigger input creates a new execution.
New form submission = workflow runs again.
This makes automation scalable.

parameters.formDescription: PREPARING PITCH DECK AND INFORMATION ABOUT THE CLIENT

parameters.content: # We can also pin the request

# üåê Step 4 ‚Äî Getting Data from External Services (APIs)

## Why External Services?
n8n does not store information itself. It connects to other services to fetch data. This happens using APIs. An API is simply a way for apps to talk to each other.

## In Our Workflow
We connect to services like:
- LinkedIn data tools
- Website research tools
- AI models
n8n sends a request ‚Üí Service returns data ‚Üí Workflow continues.

## How We Connect
Using:
- OAuth login
- API Keys
- Access Tokens
Once connected, data can be fetched automatically anytime.
``

# üåç Step 4.1 ‚Äî Searching Company Information (Why Tavily?)

## Why Not Google?
Google search is built for humans.
It returns web pages, ads, and mixed results.
Not structured data for automation.

Automations need clean, usable data.

## Why Tavily?
Tavily is built for AI and automation.
It returns structured results.
Easy to extract.
Easy to pass to the next node.

n8n sends a query ‚Üí Tavily returns company info ‚Üí We process it.

## What We Do With This Data
- Understand what the company does
- Identify services/products
- Extract positioning
- Use it for AI analysis later

# üîë Step 4.2 ‚Äî Connecting Tavily (API Key Setup)

## How to Get Tavily API Key
1. Go to tavily.com  
2. Create an account  
3. Open Dashboard  
4. Generate API Key  

Copy the key.

## How to Add in n8n
1. Open Tavily node  
2. Click ‚ÄúCreate Credential‚Äù  
3. Paste API Key  
4. Save  

Now n8n can fetch search data automatically.

# üîé Step 4.3 ‚Äî Using Tavily Search + Crawl

## Two Ways We Get Information

1. Search ‚Üí Finds insights about the company or industry.
2. Crawl ‚Üí Extracts content directly from the company website.

Search = External perspective.
Crawl = Company‚Äôs own information.

---

## How It Connects

Form Input (Company Website)
‚Üí Tavily Crawl (Get website content)
‚Üí Tavily Search (Find industry challenges)
‚Üí Data flows to next step

Each node passes its output forward.

Now we have:
- Company description
- Market positioning
- Industry challenges

This becomes the input for AI analysis.

parameters.content:
# üß† Step 6 ‚Äî Extracting & Storing Key Information

After Crawl and Search, we receive a lot of raw data.

But raw data is messy.
So we use the ‚ÄúEdit Fields‚Äù node to:
- Extract only important information
- Rename it properly
- Store it in clear variables

Example:
company_info
industry_challenges

Now instead of passing full messy data,
we pass clean structured variables forward.

## Real-Life Example
It‚Äôs like reading 50 pages of research
and writing the key points in your notebook.

Later, when you present,
you use the notes ‚Äî not the full book.
That‚Äôs exactly what we‚Äôre doing here.

# üîó Step 6.1 ‚Äî Combining All Research Data

Now we join everything together.

We use:
- Merge ‚Üí to combine Crawl and Search outputs
- Aggregate ‚Üí to group them into one structured dataset

Merge brings multiple streams into one.
Aggregate organizes them properly.

After this, we rename and structure the final output as:
company_research
industry_challenges

## Real-Life Example
It‚Äôs like collecting notes from two team members,
then compiling them into one final research document.

Now we have complete, organized information ready for AI analysis.

# üë§ Step 9 ‚Äî Getting Data from Platforms (Smart Automation Thinking)

## Why We Cannot Directly Access Everything
Tools like LinkedIn, Instagram, Amazon, or even some websites are built for humans. They don‚Äôt allow automation tools like n8n to freely access data.

Just like you log in and browse manually, automation cannot do that directly.

---

## The Smart Approach
Instead of accessing platforms directly, we use specialized services.

Example:
- LinkedIn ‚Üí Use a scraping service
- Website data ‚Üí Use crawl/search tools
- Financial data ‚Üí Use APIs
- CRM data ‚Üí Use official integrations

n8n connects to these services, not the website directly.

---

## Real-World Automation Thinking
Professionals don‚Äôt ‚Äúhack‚Äù systems.
They use:
- Official APIs
- Scraping services
- Data providers
- Automation-friendly tools

This is how scalable systems are built.

Automation is not just connecting nodes.
It‚Äôs knowing which tool to use for which job.

# üß† Step 7 ‚Äî AI as the Brain of Our System

## Why We Need AI
So far, we have collected and organized data.
Now we need something that can think.

Data alone is not useful.
We need intelligence to interpret it.

## AI = Artificial Brain
Just like we:
- Read information
- Understand context
- Identify patterns
- Make decisions

An LLM (Large Language Model) does the same ‚Äî but at scale.

## What We Use
We connect an OpenAI / ChatGPT node inside n8n.
n8n provides OpenAI credits, so we can use it directly.

We send structured research data to the AI.
AI analyzes it and generates insights.

## How the System Now Works
Data ‚Üí AI Brain ‚Üí Insights ‚Üí Output

## Important Mindset Shift
Using ChatGPT manually = AI user.
Embedding AI inside automation = AI builder.

Today, we are building systems ‚Äî not just prompting.

=You are part of the Business Development team at an AI Automation Agency that designs and implements production-ready AI-driven workflows and agents to replace or optimize manual business processes.

Your agency provides:

- AI Assistants & Chatbots
- RAG Systems (Document Q&A, Knowledge Bases)
- Workflow Automation (n8n, APIs, AI Agents)
- Decision-Making Agents
- SaaS AI Integration
- Internal AI-Powered Tools & Dashboards

The agency focuses strictly on high-ROI automation that saves time, reduces operational costs, or increases revenue.

A new company has booked a consultation call.

Your job is to analyze the provided research and generate a complete Business Development Intelligence Report that will help consultants prepare a highly personalized and high-conversion pitch.

You are provided with:

Company Website Research:
{{ $json.company_research }}

Industry Challenges Research:
{{ $json.industry_challenges }}

Your task is to generate a structured HTML report with the following sections:

Company Profile (Heading 2)
Provide a clear, professional one-paragraph summary explaining:
- What the company does
- Their positioning
- Services/products
- Market focus

Core Offerings (Heading 2)
List their main products/services in bullet point format.

Target Market (Heading 2)
Briefly explain who they serve and in which industry.

Observed Strategic Priorities (Heading 2)
Based on the website and positioning, infer 3‚Äì5 likely business priorities.

Industry Pain Points (Heading 2)
Based on the industry research and company type, list the most relevant operational or strategic pain points they are likely facing.

Pain Points and AI Solutions (Heading 2)
Create a table with 3 columns:
1. Pain Point ‚Äì What challenge they are likely facing.
2. Evidence ‚Äì Why this is relevant to them based on research.
3. AI Automation Solution ‚Äì A specific automation solution our agency can implement.

High-ROI Automation Opportunities (Heading 2)
List the 5 highest ROI automation opportunities for this company.
Sort them in order of highest impact first.
Each opportunity must include:
- Name of opportunity
- What it does
- Why it is high ROI
- Expected business impact (time saved, cost reduced, revenue improved)

Executive Pitch Angle (Heading 2)
Provide a short strategic summary explaining how our agency should position the conversation during the consultation call to maximize conversion.

Important:
- The output must be clean HTML.
- Use proper <h2>, <ul>, <li>, <table>, <tr>, <td> formatting.
- Do NOT wrap the output in ```html```.
- This report will be inserted into the middle of an existing HTML document.

Generate a complete, strategic, pitch-ready report.

parameters.content:
# ü§ñ Step 7.1 ‚Äî AI Generates Company Intelligence

Now we send the structured company data to the AI node.

The AI reads:
- Company research
- Industry challenges

Then it analyzes and converts raw information into structured insights.

Instead of just data, we now get:
- Company summary
- Core offerings
- Target market
- Business priorities

## Real-Life Example
This is like giving a research file to a business analyst.
The analyst reads everything and prepares a clean executive summary.

AI is acting as that analyst.

# üìß Step 8 ‚Äî Sending the Dynamic Email Report

The AI has generated the report in HTML format.

Now we use that HTML output as the email body.

Instead of writing a manual email,
we dynamically insert the AI response into the Gmail node.

Flow:
AI Output (HTML) ‚Üí Email Node ‚Üí Send Automatically

Every new form submission:
- Triggers research
- Generates AI report
- Sends a personalized email

## Real-Life Example
Normally, a team would:
Research ‚Üí Write report ‚Üí Copy into email ‚Üí Send manually

We automated all of it.

This connects everything:
Trigger ‚Üí Research ‚Üí AI ‚Üí Email

Now the system runs fully on its own.
![Dance] (https://media.tenor.com/Jx8GIe3ysgAAAAAi/rehman-dakait-dhurandhar.gif)

# üöÄ Step 10 ‚Äî You Just Built a Real AI System

You have now built a complete AI-powered automation system.

From:
Trigger ‚Üí Research ‚Üí Data Structuring ‚Üí AI Analysis ‚Üí Dynamic Email

This is not theory.
This is production-level automation thinking.

## Where You Can Use This

This template works for:
- Professionals automating internal workflows
- Freelancers building client automation
- Business owners scaling operations
- Agencies creating AI services

You can modify the same structure for:
Lead generation, HR screening, Sales research, Content automation, Client onboarding, Market analysis.

The system remains the same.
Only the use case changes.

## But This Is Just the Beginning

The industry is moving toward:

- AI Agents
- Multi-Agent Architectures
- RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation)
- MCP (Model Context Protocol)
- Autonomous Decision Systems
- AI SaaS Integrations
- AI Workflow Orchestration
- AI-Powered Internal Tools

Automation is evolving into intelligent systems.

Today you learned how to connect AI.
Next level is building AI that thinks, collaborates, and decides.

This is where the future is heading.
